title: Card Factory profit plunges amid 'resilient' first half - Retail Gazette
summary:
- Card Factory reported a 46.4% decline in pre-tax profit, dropping to £7.5 million for the six months ending July 31, despite a 5.9% increase in sales to £247.6 million.
- EBITDA decreased by 13.7% to £39.1 million, while adjusted EBITDA fell 2.4% to £44.2 million, indicating pressure on profitability.
- The company opened over 30 new stores, contributing to a 2.9% increase in total store revenues, showcasing a focus on expansion despite profit challenges.
- CEO Darcy Willson-Rymer emphasized a resilient performance amid inflationary pressures and outlined plans for the upcoming festive season, including new product ranges.
- Retail executives should note the importance of balancing growth strategies with profitability, especially in a challenging economic environment.
